pageContext.claim: “You don't learn from tax returns. And I'm under audit, Chuck. I've been saying it. I'm under audit. But you don't learn from tax returns.”
pageContext.analysis: There is, in fact, quite a bit that one can learn from tax returns. A century-old law allows the chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee to request any individual's tax return from the IRS. (The Trump administration is refusing to turn them over to the Democratic-controlled House.) Other presidents have released their tax returns while under audit. There's no law preventing it.
